column4: Ok, I installed ubuntu 11 yestarday, updated my NVIDIA drivers to the current version. but for some reason, now it isn't detecting my second monitor... I'm also getting many other issues.
Going here was just a complete WAIST OF TIME...
hello??
XD
Can I... please get some help...
I asked my question 3 times...
Ok, I installed ubuntu 11 yestarday, updated my NVIDIA drivers to the current version. but for some reason, now it isn't detecting my second monitor... I'm also getting many other issues.
did you update them from nvidia.com /
don't need that
did you get the nvidia drivers from nvdia.com ?
where did you get them /
ok - a 3rd party PPA, that's not something that is supported
PPA's are made by people/groups that take ownership for the stability and support of their software
no idea, it depends what they change doing the install, this is part of the risk of using a PPA
following random webpages isn't the best approach
using official ubuntu resources is always the best method
your system may not be in a usable state now after using external software
standard config changes may not work depending on what the 3rd party software has change
sure
there is also info on https://help.ubuntu.com
